column2: Shelters/food/Clothes/medicines needed in Sindupalchok Kadambas Wards 2,3 and 4
column5:
Sindupalchok, Kadambas, Wards 2,3 and 4: 
240 households amongst the 3 target wards need the following support: 
- Food (basket: rice, dhal, chiura, salt, sugar, tea); 
- Medicines 
- 215 out of the total of households are still needing tarps and clothes (notably for kids)

Our local contact told us that some assistance were brought to the village, notably by the Red Cross. 

Please note the LOCAL contact: Hari Chandra Bharati 9741088532
column19: According to Mr. Hari Chandra , they had received help from V.D.C as 1 sacks rice per house hold, salt 1 packet, oil 1 ltr, biscuits and noodles 2-3 . Also the Rotary club provided help to the ward 3 villagers such as 5 kg rice,buckets and other utensils.
column20:
According to Mr. Hari chandra , they had received help from V.D.C as 1 sacks rice per house hold, salt 1 packet, oil 1 ltr, biscuits and noodles 2-3 . Also the Rotary club provided help to the ward 3 villagers such as 5 kg rice,buckets and other utensils. Round table Nepal  gave 320 bed sheets , 100 tarpulins and 150 blankets. 
He mentioned that the food stuff they had is buried and could not be taken out till now. so they still need food stuffs.
Medical help is needed.( there was one day camp and that's not sufficient enough)

column5:
This is an appeal to support the earthquake victims of Bungkot VDC Ward No. 4, Gorkha, Nepal. A 7.8 magnitude earthquake that struck Nepal on 25th April, 2015 have obliged affected peoples live in the open fields and barren land and under the open sky too in some case though 14th day of such devastating quake had already passed.

Food and medical supplies are running quite low that too with insufficient reliefs while risks are looming large for the health epidemic as a result of temporary open shelters and unhygienic food. More than 95% of the houses (total of about 120 houses) in this area are damaged ( completely damaged houses about 90 %). With the monsoon season imminent, the need for shelter is increasing.  

I, Pradeep Parajuli, an engineering student from Kathmandu University, had personally visited this VDC yesterday (dated 7th May, 2015) with stuffs I can carry and distributed it to 3 nearby houses and help them in excavation too. I had taken photographs showing the destruction of houses, temporary settlements, tents limitation.

Herein is attached the photographs showing the miserable condition of the whole VDC. Your rescue team is doing quite good. It would be grateful if your rescue team could do something for that VDC too.

UPDATE 5/13 4:00pm - Our teams have just returned from Rasuwa after three days of assessment and relief work in the areas of Briddim, Khangjim, Sherpagoan, Thuman, Timure, Ghattekhola, and Khaidi. Thankfully, additional damage from the May 12th earthquake was not significant in most of Rasuwa, though landslides and new collapses occurred. The road from Syaphru through Dhunche to KTM remains open and passable for trucks, and we are working to send two to three trucks to Rasuwa tomorrow with supplies. We will provide a more detailed update soon.
However, the road from Syaphru to Rasuwagadhi is still blocked in Lingling.

column2: Sindhupalchowk, Ward 4 - No Relief since first quake
column5: After visiting various villages and assessing the damage (photographs, data and village contacts available), we can confirm that 80% of homes in ward 4 in Sindhupalchowk have been completely destroyed. There are villages cut off at the top of a hill due to a landslide. They urgently need tarps, food, blankets and warm clothes.
column20: @Verifiers - please also check Sindhupalchowk ko kun VDC ko ward #4.

column2: Tin sheets rewquired for quake victims in Namjung, Gorkha
column5: More than 80% of the houses are collapsed/damaged by the earthquake followed by aftershocks in Namjung VDC of Gorkha. All Six schools (1 higer secondary, 2 lower secondary and three primary) building are severely damaged. Because of labor shortage, re-construction of houses and school buildings is not possible before monsoon. The best alternative will be to provide tin roofs that can be used to create temporary shelter by people themselves. These sheets are usable while reconstructing their house in future.

Mr. Uzen is in talks with several organizations regarding the issue and will keep us updated through the comments regarding any update.

Also, if any organization can supply the tents, they are ready to transport them to the above mentioned VDCs.

column5:
MAY 13 NIGHT
OKHLDHUNGA, BIGUT VDC
SHELTER NEEDED
Bigutar VDC Okhaldhuna. Highly affected after May 12, 2015 Turmoil. No House is standing. Only requirement right now is Shelter.
We will arrange transportation (Uzen - 9841276950) till District headquarter, Need temporary shelter. Please let us know if any one can provide any support.
400 Houses and around 2500 people affected,
Chances of road block due to landslide. Might have to walk for up to 3 hours depending on the landslide.
Local Contact Person: Uddhav Bhattarai (VDC Secretary) - 9849362985

Reoprt submitted by Javed Shah
column20:
The local contact, Mr Uddhav Bhattarai is reachable and responsive.

The houses were only damaged, not collapsed by the first earthquake, but the second one has rendered most of them unlivable.

According to information by the local contact, the VDC has managed to provide 50 tarps but they still need 350-400 more. 

The location is remote because of the landslide, people need to walk 2.5 to 3 hours to reach the location. 

The team at Subisu are trying to contact organizations that can help them provide relief and will keep us updated.

column2: Sindhupalchok - Ghorthali - No Relief Since First Quake
column5:
Based on interview with eyewitness and verified by contact with teacher at the school on morning of March 13: "Tungathali, ghorthali its 7-8 hours walk from Bahrabise, sidhupalchowk.  Peoples haven't eaten anything and are sustaining eating dead goats and buffalos. Talked with Dal Bahadur Gurung who is a teacher at Ghorthali School he says no Relief has been yet reported here and peoples are dying everyday because of lack of medicines and Proper Food and clothes."

column2: American Volunteers with Medical Supplies Looking for Places to go
column5:
Two American volunteers from California have two suitcases of basic medical supplies and are looking for leads to go to communities that are in need.

They will be here for at least a month and are also looking for groups and organizations to collaborate with. They will have some funding for other supplies and relief works.

Please call Alex at 9810152328

Posted on Facebook


As per the social workers of Gorkha, Peoples of northern Gorkha (Uhiya VDC) are not getting relief materials including food and tripal, if you have any support materials please contact me. Bhola Bhattarai 9851074770

column2: Urgent need of Helicopter for Relief Supplies/Distribution in northern VDCs of Dhading- Ri, Jharlang, Tipling, Sertung, Lapa, Darkha, Satyadevi and Baseri.
column5: Relief materials are ready but there is urgent need of choppers to carry these logistic/relief materials to the most needed places. Road links are cut-off due to landslides and suspension bridges are also damaged causing inaccessibility to these areas.
column19: Please contact Mr. Damodar Aryal, Executive Director of Prayash Nepal and Chair of NGO-Federation of Dhading (9851128228) for any coordination if any organization/individual wants to provide helicopter service. This organization has collected relief mater
column20: Please contact Mr. Damodar Aryal, Executive Director of Prayash Nepal and Chair of NGO-Federation of Dhading (9851128228) for any coordination if any organization/individual wants to provide helicopter service. This organization has collected relief materials.

column4: Barun Valley, Makalu Barun National Park, Koshi, Eastern Region, Nepal, 56900
column5: We trekked out from makalu to Num then road to Tumlingtar from 4 to 9 May.  The regional town is Kadbari. There are 33 VDC in this region. We can confirm that the there are no casualties from 25 April Earthquake in this this region. There is some building damage. In Shedowa VDC 59 homes and some schools have been destroyed, other VDC are much less affected. From what we could see and ask about, there is no need for emergency help.

Posted on NERVC's Facebook page. "Sinchupalchok DVC" is what the original poster wrote. I don't know the name of the village or VDC but the phone # is below. 

EVENING MAY 11
Relief needed:
Sindhupalchok DVC, Ward 08 and 09 still not enough shelter, we would like to support to them. if any one have a resource for relief please call 9841397842

column2: Syabrubesi, Rasuwa - tents urgently needed for 600 people
column4: Syapru Besi, Bagmati, Central Region, Nepal, 45000
column5:
Posted on NERVC's Facebook page. In reply to this post someone said she had been in Rasuwa and had met a group of foreigners who were heading to Shyabrubesi with 7 trucks of relief materials but I can't confirm whether this happened or not. 

5:00AM MONDAY MAY 11
Tirpals or tents urgently needed for Shyabrubesi, Rasuwa... approx 600 people heavily affected with no shelter currently sleeping in few very congested temporary shelters, if you can help please contact me via FB or on +977 981 017 30 77
column19: Shyabrubesi Ward no 1 and 9 have received only 8 tents and some tarps. 3 bags of rice per house (22 household in ward no9) and Rs 7000 (per house) provided by the Govt. They still need more tarps. Emailed Rasuwa Relief about it waiting to hear back from t
column20: Spoke to (9810173077) who gave the contact information of Binita Tamang (9741189252) who informs Shyabrubesi Ward no 1 and 9 have received only 8 tents and some tarps. 3 bags of rice per household (there are 22 household in ward no9) and Rs 7000 (per house) was distributed by the Govt. But they still need more tent or tarps. Emailed Rasuwa Relief about it waiting to hear back from them.

column5:
Posted on NERVC's Facebook page:

5:00AM MONDAY MAY 11
Some 200 people at Hokse, ward no. 8, Panchkhal, Kavre need some food supplies and relief materials. Please contact Nakul BK at 9849057692
column19: Got in touch with Shalav Rana (9841019395) from LOOKS Nepal who asked to be emailed the details.
column20: Spoke to Nakul Bk (9849057692) who informed that there are 230 people who have till date only received 65 tents and minimal food supplies (2-3 kg of rice per house). Got in touch with Shalav Rana (9841019395) from LOOKS Nepal who asked to be emailed the details.

Please help us 
Govinda Regmi 

9751008461

No more food material needed in Gunsakot Sindhupalchowk anymore. Total of 9 wards but all clustered in same hill. 

Only request for toilet building and school building

Villagers in Tipling, sherdung and Barang villages in Dhading district are stranded due to landslide and haven't gotten any aid yet. 85 percent of Barang village destroyed due to the earthquake and almost 200 families are homeless. Around 800 villagers are injured and need urgent medical, shelter and food relief. The Himalayan Buddhist Society Center are collecting medical, tents and food to bring it to these villages. It would be Greatly appreciated if we could get these supply and help those villagers who have been waiting in hope to get some help from Kathmandu. 
Thank you.

Sincerely,

Himalayan Buddhist Society Center
column6: Building Collapsed, Medical Facility, Camp, Medical Assiatance, Food/Water/Shelter/Sanitation,

column5:
On 9 May 8 truck-loads of ADRA-supported relief packages were distributed to long lines of victims of Maidi VDC by local stakeholders supported by ADRA and RIMS. Relief was well-organised. On 10 May a second load will reach there. Roads are okay.
Maidi has no casualties and very few injured, and while maybe only 5% houses were flattened, still about 80-90% will have to rebuild their houses.  In all villages I visited people, people live outside their house in tents or bamboo-CGI sheet constructions. 50% got tents, others got or bought CGI sheets.

Need permanent shelter and education.
column19: The basic survival needs are fulfilled. The need now is permanent shelter and education.

column5:
Dear All,
This is to kindly inform you all that in the far west region of Gorkha, due to the landslide the roads(kaccha) also have seems to be destroyed completely, taking away more than 150 Donkeys death, which use to carry loads to reach up the mountain, near the lake.
Today is the fifteenth day and currently there is no source of way to reach up there, except for the expert climbers. It is sad to tell you all that the local people in that zone who we met told me that the locals there have all started feeling that they belongs to no one’s lands, as time has passed and they are just left haphazardly with no source of basic relief until now.
I do not know how to put up this word correctly but I have this strong feeling that the leaders of the country who are leading are playing with the sentiments of the civilians right now, be it you me or any.
It is of a big surprise to me that how it is even possible for the government to charge one and half lakh to two and half lakhs, of rupees for delivering the relief material to anyone interested at that particular zone?  Where else the relief material that only fits in the helicopters are worth not even more than fifty to sixty thousand rupees only, is a question to me.
This is not the time to do business is how I think. Either we have forgotten our rights to public property else the government has forgotten it’s the public’s property.
Finally, after the fifteenth day the Secretary of the wards that you will see in the video(First left hand side of the screen is Dhurbaraj Parajuli, a Secretary of Keranju, VDC-9) is moving today along with other EIGHTY SEVEN i.e. 9th May. Where else when I tried to reach out to the CDO of Gorkha district, his cell phone was switched
.  Eventually I consider this INHUMAN!!!!
I, would kindly request you all to appeal in this regard as many of our brothers, sisters, mothers and fathers are all crying out loud for help and we think should also think outside the box as I am sharing the correct information if you all are not informed well, that there has been no relief material properly sent there .
Let us all help!!!!!
Here is some collective information please kindly get an idea how to reach there. 
Most importantly we should ask for free service
P.S. I do not recommend anyone to go hiking there with the relief material as we were told that it’s an unusual and awkward small thin ways where soil erosions are high, every day, along with 100 meters down there is a river flowing
The routes to reach there are as follows:
Day 1: Kathmandu - Gorkha Bazaar to Swoti (By Bus) Manabu (Hiking)
Hiking starts
Day 2: Manabu - Dauraht- Dhunche - Chaihtey Khola - Kashigaun (O/N)
Day 3: Kashigaun – Ahi Khola – Kerauja (O/N)
Day 4: Rumhchet – Jhulchuk – Doh Bahn – Sauli Bhatti – Jhayam Khola – Dahdye Bharyang – Jagat (sirdibas) (O/N)
Day 5: Jagat (Sirdibas) – Salairi – Ghatey Khola – Fhilm – Chisopani – Nayang Fedi – Pewa – Uyang (O/N)
Day 6: Uyang - Rana – Dafridi – Gup – Prok – Nahmrung (O/N)
Day 7: Nahmrung – Relcham – Legam – Sachau – Lay Gau – Syala
Day 8: Syala – Samagaun. (O/N)
Keranju – Village Development Committee – Ward no. 9

Truly Yours,
Bikesh Kayastha.

column2: Shelter &amp; sanitation materials, volunteer engineers requested for 600 families
column5:
Approximately 600 familiesfrom surrounding areas have gathered at 27.967582, 84.996893 following the earthquake. Through my volunteer work with StandbyTaskforce, I was initially in contact with them in the first week, as they sought food and medical assistance for their injured. Today, the english speaking man in their group (Uday Parattha Ph. +977 9849027000), contacted me again by phone to see if I could pass through a request for engineers and materials to help build shelter for their genuinely displaced people only.

So I believe that many of the initial 600 families have no shelter or sanitation. They are seeking plastic sheeting to make shelters from, and hopefully some engineers to help them prepare shelter and sanitaytion (toilet) facilities.

In the long term, they are interested in building a district centre combining public health and education, and hope some engineers may volunteer to help with that but right now they are seeking seom materials and volunteer engineer help with sanitation facilities and shelter for their displaced families.

I tried calling Uday again, while filing this request, to get a better understanding of how many people require shelter but I could not get through.

I am reporting this from Australia - my name is Alistair Hart (+61 409 885 776 - alistair@mangoesmapping.com.au). I was helping with SBTF prior to our being stood down when we handed over our data to KLL. That is why this man Unday has contacted me,as I've been managing his initial request when we were active.

NB. I could not find a location name for this village and cannot locate my original request in the SBTF google sheets, so the Location name I have used is the closest I could find in Google Earth. Katunjepuni the location I have nominated is ~6-7KM west of the actual location of the families requiring shelter.

column2: Houses destroyed in Mirre Village destroyed,Thokarpa VDC
column5:
Hamro vlz ko name Mirre ho .hamro vlz maa 32 dhuri xa. Sabai ghar dhuri basna kaa lagi ramro xaina 
Sabai ghar dhalna lageko xa Adhikamsa manxe darayeka xan 
Rahat ko naama maa 1 bora chamal aayeko xa  1 otq ghar ladera 1 buffalo ra 1 ota 1 cow mareko xa 4 otta goat mareko xa  ghar haru purai xeti grasta xan  yehaka manis haru sabai barimaa paal tagera baseka xan

Translation:
Our village's name is Mirre. There are 32 houses in our village but they are not good for staying inside anymore. They are in near state of collapsing. All of us are scared.
In the name of relief, we have received 1 sack of rice. Collapsing of a house has killed 1 buffalo, 1 cow and 4 goats. People here are using tents to live in.

Contact number: 9611131234
column20: The contact number is switched off.

column2: URGENT: People stranded at Village Yangri, district Sindhupalchowk
column4: Hyolmo Ama Yangri, Langtang National Park, Bagmati, Central Region, Nepal
column5:
"We were informed by villagers when we landed that 25 families were stranded on top of the hill separated because of mud slide and stranded with no food for days. We took one of the local villagers with us.

We had no place to land the chopper so we hovered 30 ft in air, opened the chopper door in high wind and rain and threw food out the door to them. It was scary and risky but worth every effort.

They need evacuation. This supply likely will last them only a few days.

We barely just put a band aid on a bleeding jugular. This village is 15 minutes flight from KTM airport. 
Gokul Thapa is my hero who risked his life to save these people. I was holding him while he threw 30 kg bags of rice out the door. I don't need your money , I need your voice call, you congressman call your media. The world needs to know.

This is a humanitarian catastrophe. 
They will die of hunger and exposure or mud slides once the monsoon arrives if they make it through the next few weeks. I can't save them all. I need your voice, so the Nepalese government and world
Agencies can hear us loud and clear.

Village Yangri, district Sindhupalchowk"
column20: No contact details.

column5:
Please consider sending help to an orphanage north of Kathmandu at Ward no 8. Targeswor, Thule Gaon. Basic food supplies have been distributed to them, but their home is badly damaged. There are 35 children living there. Local contact is Pema Yanji Sherpa, treasurer for Assist Development Project in Nepal (ADPIN)
Her mobile number is +977 9818106344
column20: How can I help?

column2: Need of earthquake rescue team urgently in Bungkot-4, Gorkha, Nepal
column5:
Dear Sir/Madam,

This is an appeal to support the earthquake victims of Bungkot VDC Ward No. 4, Gorkha, Nepal. A 7.8 magnitude earthquake that struck Nepal on 25th April, 2015 have obliged affected peoples live in the open fields and barren land and under the open sky too in some case though 14th day of such devastating quake had already passed.

Food and medical supplies are running quite low that too with insufficient reliefs while risks are looming large for the health epidemic as a result of temporary open shelters and unhygienic food. More than 95% of the houses (total of about 120 houses) in this area are damaged ( completely damaged houses about 90 %). With the monsoon season imminent, the need for shelter is increasing.  

I, Pradeep Parajuli, an engineering student from Kathmandu University, had personally visited this VDC yesterday (dated 7th May, 2015) with stuffs I can carry and distributed it to 3 nearby houses and help them in excavation too. I had taken photographs showing the destruction of houses, temporary settlements, tents limitation.

Herein is attached the photographs showing the miserable condition of the whole VDC. Your rescue team is doing quite good. I would be grateful if your rescue team could do something for that VDC too.

Contact personnel:
Nabin Shrestha : +977-9849631666
Address: Bungkot – 4, Gorkha, Nepal
Thank you.

Looking forward on hearing positive repose from you.
Thank you.
 
Regards,
Pradeep Parajuli
column20:
Bungkot VDC Ward no. - 4, Gorkha, Nepal have 100 houses among which maximum have destroyed due to earthquake.
The region doesn't require Water, Medical support.

They need Tents and Food supply.
They have road accessible.

column2: No relief yet in Gumba VDC
column5: No relief materials of any kind has arrived in remote Gumba VDC. Please do as much as you can to get relief there. There are no roads in VDC. Have to walk for 4-5 hours.
column19: We sent 330 household supplies to Gumba VDC, Wards 7 and 8, on Sunday, May 10th. The truck went 6 hours up to Khatike and then the supplies were carried by villagers 6 hours to their communities. Since the earthquake on May 12th, we have had no contact wi
column20: Spoke to Mr. Tshering Lama. It's difficult to reach anyone above Dhareykhola at the moment because of bad network connection, and the road to Gumba VDC is blocked. However, a few people came down from Gumba VDC to the town today and they have not reported any human casualty so there should be no need for immediate concern.

column5:
With a population of 4169 people and 1019 houses, Pangretar VDC in Sindhupalchwok district has suffered significant damage to many houses. On record, 24 people died of earthquake, while 39 injured are getting some local treatment. 

Among the people from this VDC, 890 are children less than 16 years of age. They are living with their family in makeshift arrangements, which they could manage from the damaged buildings. No relief aid in terms of tents for shelter, water purification pills has reached this place yet. This information is based on the VDC official from this place.
column19: Spoke to the contact (9841384666). They need tents for 925 households. They were given food supplies by Srijan Sheel Mahila Samuha (12 kg rice, 5 kg dal and 1 packet of rice) Medical centers have been established. They have the money to buy tents but have
column20:
Spoke to the contact (9841384666). 
They need tents for 925 households.
They were given food supplies by Srijan Sheel Mahila Samuha (12 kg rice, 5 kg dal and 1 packet of rice)
Medical centers have been established.
They have the money to buy tents but haven't been able to buy it because of shortage.

1) Rice - 1800 KG (60 Pack)
2) Dal - 120 KG
3) Salt - 60 KG
4) Oil - 30 liter (ideally half liter)

column2: 350 tents urgently needed in Sankhu Town
column4: Sankhu, Pukhulachhi, Bagmati, Central Region, Nepal, 44600
column5:
The earthquake has devastated the historic town of a Sankhu  now part of Shankarpur Municipality. Majority of centuries old mud brick house have collapsed leaving approx 740 people in Illa Tole in Sankhu homeless. Urgently require 350 tents to shelter the families a lot of elderlies and children before the start of monsoon.

Please contact Dwarika Nath Shrestha on 9851001656 who is a resident in Illa Tole who will coordinate the delivery.
column19: verified 350 tents needed
column20: Verified that they require 350 tents for shelter. No problems with food, medicines at present.

column2: Sipaghat, Kavre districts needs urgent help
column5: In direct daily contact with villager, Prem Shrestha, in Sipaghat in the Kavre district. They are out of food and need shelter urgently. They haven't received any relief. It's a large village of a couple of thousand. Basically all homes destroyed and many deaths. I am reporting from America. I have told prem to report also but I am not sure how possible this is to do on his phone in his current state.
column20: No contact information.

column5: 4000 people in this area are in need. Tents, food, blankets major damage is across all homes. We can collect any supplies in Kathmandu. Also need a professional to make a report of what more is needed in the longer term as I am co-ordinating efforts for this area from Ireland. Call Krishna Raj Kanel if you can help in any way on 9841657103
column20:
Spoke to Krishna Raj Khanel (9841657103) who informed that they NEED traps/ tents. They have been supported by Lion's Club, Help Nepal and Hamro Sathi with food and shelter but its not sufficient. 
They are focusing in Chhatre Dyaurali and Jeewanpur which are 2 VDCs. The relief they have received are NOT SUFFICIENT.

column2: Rasuwa village Bhorle, Bagmati aid needed
column5: A Dibaraj (Shankar Neupane) posted on Facebook Langtang Missing/Found People group page on 5/5/15 3:43PM PST an urgent need of aid to the Bhorle, Bagmati village in Rasuwa. At the time of the Post no aid had reached Bhorle.  Dibaraj indicated their home was destroyed and is sleeping outside with his wife and two babies, and have no food.  Attempted further contact with Dibaraj has failed, we were able to confirm the aid requirements for the village, yet situation is desperate. Immediate need is required if this area is still pending relief aid.  Dibaraj's address is Rasuwa Bhorle Vic no.7 Badahare.
column20: please provide your  contact number.

column5:
A village named ‘Chainpur’ and surrounding village in ‘Dhading district’, most of peoples in there need immediate helps, mostly houses and cattle cottages are destroyed by quake. They are under sky and didn’t getting yet any relief from government and any organizations.

Since I am from same village and district, I would like to help them for their immediate inhabitant, foods, medicine, etc; but personally I am unable to help as their requirement.

So, if anyone or organizations interested to help like those victims, I would sincerely requesting you to help those peoples. Let me know or leave me a private message for further details.

I'm looking forward you for any response from you.

Kind regards,
Yam
9803623933, 9851189417
column20: Around 400 houses 250 are totally destroyed. Some sort of government relief has been provided, but this person couldn't provided full information about how much government relief has been provided and said he will provide later. Address-chainpur-1

column4: Tribhuvan International Airport, Ring Road, Kathmandu, Bagmati, Central Region, Nepal, 44600
column5:
DFID-GIZ Risk Management Office (RMO)

SITREP AS AT 1300 HRS THURSDAY 07 MAY 2015

1.   Key Highlights
 

·         The meeting of the legislature-parliament is scheduled to begin at 3 pm today, 07 May to discuss the post-earthquake situation, relief and rehabilitation to the victims of the disaster.

2.   Airport Status

·         Kathmandu airport and regional airports are all reported operational.

3.   Road Situation

Most major roads in the country are open. Road access to heavily affected Village Development Committees (VDCs) possible via the following routes:

·         Nuwakot / Rasuwa: Trisuli / Bidur to Dhunche road is open. However only small vehicles (4 x 4 jeeps) are allowed. Caution is advised due to risk of new landslides. It is not advised to travel the route at night. Relief vehicles should register with the police post in Kalikasthan before proceeding to Dhunche.  

·         Dhading: The gravel road from Dhading Besi to Tripureshwor VDC via Katunje VDC is open (25 km). However only small vehicles (4 x 4 jeeps) are allowed.

·         Nuwakot: The gravel road connecting Trishuli Bazar/ Bidur Municiapality to Kintang VDC via Deurali VDC is operational (35 km). It is passable for heavy trucks.

·         Gorkha: The road from Gorkha District Headquarters to Arughat (Arupokhari VDC) is operational and encompasses a  distance of 43 km. The road from Arughat to Soti Khola (Lapu VDC) is also open now. 

·         Dolakha: the main road via Khadichaur, Sindhupalchowk, Mude, Charikot and Mainapokhari to Jiri is open.

·         Sindhupalchowk: Araniko highway between Bahrabise and Tatopani road is open. However only small vehicles (4 x 4 jeeps) are allowed. Caution is advised due to risk of new landslides. It is not advised to travel the route at night. Roads between Kathmandu and Melamchi are open

 

 

The following closures are reported:

·         Gorkha: from 10 kilo, a place in Mirkot VDC-Chhepetar-Bhaluswanra-Warpak VDC section (36 km) is obstructed due to debris from landslide caused by the earthquake.

·         Dolakha: Charikot to Singati Bajar, Jhyaku VDC is open. However the road is obstructed from Singati Bajar to Lamabagar VDC.

·         Bhaktapur: Roads inside the main city are obstructed due to debris but are in the process of being cleared.

4.   Security Updates

NTR

5.   Updates by District
 

Gorkha: 06 May, according to District Education Office (DEO) in Gorkha district, more than 80% of 498 government schools buildings have collapsed whereas remaining 20% have been partially damaged. The destruction of school has affected approximately 84,000 students in the district.

6.   Forecasted Weather
·         07 May, Showers  and  thunderstorms  are  expected  across  Nepal  on  Thursday,  particularly  across  the mountains but there is a continued moderate probability of a thunderstorm in Kathmandu. The focus for thunderstorms is likely to be across eastern Nepal, where some could be severe with hail and flooding rains. There is a low risk of locally heavy rainfall triggering landslides, and with higher warmer temperatures  in  mountainous  regions  than  recently,  increased  snow  melt  is  expected  at  lower elevations. This increases the risks for avalanches at higher elevations.

·         08 May, There is a consistent signal for a further significant increase of clouds, shower and thunderstorms across Nepal, including Kathmandu, on Friday and throughout the weekend. These storms will produce a significant risk of hail, flooding rains, landslides and increasingly strong gusty downdrafts. The snow level will rise further to 4200-4400 meters. This may continue to increase the level of snow melt at lower elevations, while increasing the avalanche risk in higher elevations. Maximum temperature at Kathmandu will be a little lower as in the previous days at around 26 or 27 Celsius.

7.   Further information 

Helpful data and maps are available at:

https://data.hdx.rwlabs.org/nepal-earthquake

http://mapaction.org/map-catalogue/maps.html?deployment_filter=240

http://www.icimod.org/?q=17913

column5:
A helicopter load with emergency supplies as per standard government rice pax allowance plus goods/materials according to specified needs by local population was delivered yesterday. This was organized by some local families/KTM residents in coordination with Rolwaling Foundation (Norway/Nepal). Probably access to sat phone and functioning solar electricity (however, not specified). 
Australian Himalayan Foundation has been informed. Beding, Nyamare, Be. 

Surveyed the area from ground and air:
Nobody killed or severely injured by earth quake damage. 52 residents in 30 homes, most people staying in Beding and some in Na, 2-3 hrs apart. 95% of the houses have cracks, 60% "damaged", 12 houses totally destroyed. Monastery and gomba need reconstruction. Lodges apparently standing. Have potatoes, water. Other immediate needs so far covered by the heli load. Awaiting report on trail access to Rolwaling from the Tamakoshi side; at this time the condition of footbridges from Chetchet up to Rolwaling is not ascertained.  Alternative access trail(s) exist, but cumbersome. Road from Singati to Chetchet (and possibly further to the Tibet border) currently closed. Fund collection for reconstruction in Nepal and Norway in progress. The Rolwaling Foundation will enter Rolwaling with relief supplies during the last half of May and start organization of reconstruction.

column5:
Ram delivered 100 tarpaulins and medical aid to one ward of Thulo Sirubari on 6th May. 130 of 134 houses in the ward are fallen or uninhabitable. Food stores largely destroy and some food aid needed, and being arranged by Ram. 

A large delivery of tarps/paal arrived the same day so that need still present but diminished. 

Including this data for any organization working in Thulo Sirubari.
column20: Spoke to Ram (	9849754745) who informed that there are 1000+ households in the area but he has been able to supply only 100 tents. There is a desperate need for tents, food and medical supplies. He also said that people are suffering from diarrhea and there is a need for water purifiers. He said he will call back after 5 to give detailed information.

column5:
DFID-GIZ Risk Management Office (RMO)

SITREP AS AT 1300 HRS WEDNESDAY 06 MAY 2015

1.   Key Highlights
 

NTR

2.   Airport Status

·         Kathmandu airport and regional airports are all reported operational. However due to damage to the runway, the authorities have announced that the following types of airplanes will no longer receive permits to land in Kathmandu: C17, Boeing 747, Boeing 777, Airbus A330, CC 177. This applies even if the weight limit of 196 tonnes is not reached. However, it is not clear to which extent this restriction is being implemented as some flights exceeding this limit have been in operation.

3.   Road Situation

Most major roads in the country are open. Road access to heavily affected VDCs is open via the following routes:

·         Nuwakot / Rasuwa: Trisuli / Bidur to Dhunche road is open. However only small vehicles (4 x 4 jeeps) are allowed. Caution is advised due to risk of new landslides. It is not advised to travel the route at night. Relief vehicles should register with the police post in Kalikasthan before proceeding to Dhunche.  

·         Dhading: The gravel road from Dhading Besi to Tripureshwor VDC via Katunje VDC is open (25 km). However only small vehicles (4 x 4 jeeps) are allowed.

·         Nuwakot: The gravel road connecting Trishuli Bazar/ Bidur Municiapality to Kintang VDC via Deurali VDC is operational (35 km). It is passable for heavy trucks.

·         Gorkha: The road from Gorkha District Headquarters to Arughat (Arupokhari VDC) is operational, distance 43 km. The road from Arughat to Soti Khola (Lapu VDC) is also now open. 

·         Dolakha: the main road via Khadichaur, Sindhupalchowk, Mude, Charikot and Mainapokhari to Jiri is open.

·         Sindhupalchowk: Araniko highway between Bahrabise and Tatopani road is open. However only small vehicles (4 x 4 jeeps) are allowed. Caution is advised due to risk of new landslides. It is not advised to travel the route at night. Roads between Kathmandu and Melamchi are open

 

The following closures are reported:

·         Dolakha: Charikot to Singati Bajar, Jhyaku VDC is open. However road is obstructed from Singati Bajar to Lamabagar VDC.

·         Bhaktapur: Roads inside the main city are obstructed due to debris but are in the process of being cleared.

4.   Security Updates

NTR

5.   Updates by District
 

NTR

column5:
Dear all,
 
please find below the links to the just published Road Assessment Forms in English and Nepali.
 
We are kindly requesting your support to collect road access constraint information with the help of your staff and send back any relevant info to the Risk Management Office (RMO) at the following email address rmo@rmo.org.np.
 
The RMO will compile the info received and the Logistics Cluster will map the details in access constraints maps per district. The detailed maps will be published on logcluster.org.
 
Nepali:
http://logcluster.org/document/nepal-road-assessment-form-nepalese-3-may-2015
 
English:
http://logcluster.org/document/nepal-road-assessment-form 
 
Thank you for your cooperation,
RMO

DFID-GIZ Risk Management Office (RMO)

SITREP AS AT 1300 HRS TUESDAY 05 MAY 2015

1.   Key Highlights
 

·         The earthquake on 25 April and following aftershocks damaged around 14 hydropower plants across the country resulting in loss of 150 MW of electricity. In order to meet the demand, Nepal Electricity Authority (NEA), the state owned power utility, is importing 210 MW from India.

2.   Airport Status

·         Kathmandu airport and regional airports are all reported operational. However due to damage to the runway the authorities have announced that the following types of airplanes will no longer receive permits to land in Kathmandu: C17, Boeing 747, Boeing 777, Airbus A330, CC 177. This applies even if the weight limit of 196 tonnes is not reached. However, it is not clear to which extent this restriction is being implemented as some flights exceeding this limit have been in operation.

3.   Road Situation

Most major roads in the country are open. Road access to heavily affected VDCs is open via the following routes:

·         Nuwakot / Rasuwa: Trisuli / Bidur to Dhunche road is open. However only small vehicles (4 x 4 jeeps) are allowed. Caution is advised due to risk of new landslides. It is not advised to travel the route at night. Relief vehicles should register with the police post in Kalikasthan before proceeding to Dhunche.  

·         Dhading: The gravel road from Dhading Besi to Tripureshwor VDC via Katunje VDC is open (25 km). However only small vehicles (4 x 4 jeeps) are allowed.

·         Nuwakot: The gravel road connecting Trishuli Bazar/ Bidur Municiapality to Kintang VDC via Deurali VDC is operational (35 km). It is passable for heavy trucks.

·         Gorkha: The road from Gorkha District Headquarters to Arughat (Arupokhari VDC) is operational, distance 43 km. The road from Arughat to Soti Khola (Lapu VDC) is also now open. 

·         Dolakha: the main road via Khadichaur, Sindhupalchowk, Mude, Charikot and Mainapokhari to Jiri is open.

The following closures are reported:

·         Sindhupalchok: Araniko highway between Bahrabise and Tatopani

·         Sindhupalchok: the road between Kathmandu and Melamchi is obstructed by landslide at Tipeni Bazar, 9 km before Melamchi.

·         Dolakha: Charikot to Lamabagar VDC.

·         Bhaktapur: Roads inside the main city are obstructed due to debris but are in the process of being cleared.

4.   Security Updates

·         Ramechhap, 03 May:  locals picketed Manthali Municipality office accusing favoritism in relief material distribution by the municipality administration.

·         Nuwakot, 04 May: Residents of Charghare VDC protested against the local administration and political parties accusing them of delay in relief distribution.  

5.   Updates by District
 

NTR

6.   Further information 

Helpful data and maps are available at:

https://data.hdx.rwlabs.org/nepal-earthquake

column5:
DFID-GIZ Risk Management Office (RMO)

SITREP AS AT 1300 HRS MONDAY 04 MAY 2015

1.   Key Highlights
2.   Airport Status

·         Kathmandu airport and regional airports are all reported operational. However due to damage to the runway the following types of airlines will no longer receive permits to land in Kathmandu, even if the weight limit of 196 tonnes is not reached: C17, Boeing 747, Boeing 777, Airbus A330, CC 177. It is reported that this restriction will not affect aid flights.

3.   Road Situation

Most major roads in the country are open. Road access to heavily affected VDCs is open via the following routes:

·         Nuwakot / Rasuwa: Trisuli / Bidur to Dhunche road is now open. However only small vehicles (4 x 4 jeeps) are allowed.

·         Gorkha: The road from Gorkha District Headquarters to Arughat (Arupokhari VDC) is operational, distance 43 km. The road from Arughat to Soti Khola (Lapu VDC) is also now open. 

·         Northern Nuwakot / Dhading: The gravel road from Trisuli / Bidur (Nuwakot district headquarters) to Kimtang VDC is in good condition and passable for heavy trucks. From Kimtang VDC, heavily affected VDCs of northern Dhading, Satyadevi and Darkha, are accessible on foot. The distance from Trisuli to Kimtang VDC is 35 km. (Kathmandu-Trisuli is 85 km by paved road in good condition.)

·         Dolakha: the main road via Khadichaur, Sindhupalchowk, Mude, Charikot and Mainapokhari to Jiri is open.

·          

The following closures are reported:

·         Sindhupalchok: Araniko highway between Bahrabise and Tatopani

·         Sindhupalchok: the road between Kathmandu and Melamchi is obstructed by landslide at Tipeni Bazar, 9 km before Melamchi.

·         Dolakha: Charikot to Lamabagar VDC

·         Bhaktapur: Roads inside the main city are obstructed due to debris but are likely to be cleared by evening today.

4.   Security Updates

·         Sindhupalchok, 03 May: a truck with 100 bags of rice for Tauthali VDC was stopped by the local people of Thumpakhar VDC on the highway around 02:00 pm. The truck was the last of a group of 4 trucks carrying relief materials supported by Child Fund Japan travelling with the police escort. The truck was allowed to continue after handing over 32 bags of rice to the locals. 

·         Dolakha, 03 May: relief material supplied by Nepal Food Corporation for Singti, Laduk VDC, was confiscated by locals on the way at Lamidanda VDC.

5.   Updates by District
 

Lalitpur

In remote southern VDCs of the district more than 50% of the houses have been destroyed completely and more than 40% have suffered partial damage. The affected VDCs are Devichour, Dhusel, Malta, Pyutar, Asrang, Gimdi, Thuladurlung, Chandanpur, Kaleshwor, Gotikhel, Bukhel, Sankhu, Ikudol, Bhattedanda, Dalchoki, Lele, Nallu, Bhardev, Chaughare and Manikhel.

6.   Further information 

Helpful data and maps are available at:

https://data.hdx.rwlabs.org/nepal-earthquake

http://www.icimod.org/nepalearthquake2015

column2: We have TARPS for sale (&gt;5000 Ready for Delivery)
column5:
It was a very grief stricken devastating earth quake that Nepal had to
&gt; go through. We, from Pakistan, are equally depressed and stand with
&gt; the affected. Ready to provide support to Nepal in the best possible
&gt; way we can. Mahroz Textile Industries is one of the largest
&gt; Manufacturer, Exporters and Suppliers of Canvas Cloth, Tents,
&gt; Tarpaulins Towel, Bed Sheet, Grey Cloth, Twill, Drill, Duck, C.R.T,
&gt; all kinds of textile items and relief products (Hygiene Kits, Sleeping
&gt; Mats, Blankets, Kitchen Sets, Jerry Cans, Food Bags, and Mosquito
&gt; Nets) based at Lahore Pakistan. We have our own vertical set up from
&gt; spinning to stitching with enough production capacity and backup stock
&gt; to meet the need of the hour.
&gt; It came to our knowledge that you are purchasing relief Tents and
&gt; other relief products for earth quake. So regarding this dilemma, if
&gt; you have any demand/requirements for relief tents and other relief
&gt; products, the supply would be made to you on urgent basis. We have
&gt; 10,000 tents in our stock , ready for delivery within 1-2 days.
&gt;
&gt; Please note the Relief Tents Stock quantity and production capacity as
&gt; under.
&gt;
&gt; 1. 4 x 4 M Tent
&gt; Canvas Water Proof Cadre Green Color
&gt; And complete with all accessories pegs, pins, rings and hammer etc.
&gt; Packing: One Tent Pack in One bale.
&gt; Stock: 5000 Tents (Ready for delivery)
&gt; Manufacturing Capacity: 1000 Tents daily.

In view of the above, we have keen desire to serve your esteemed department on long term basis. Further for your kind information we are sending you our technical / machinery details with attached file.

Tel: +92 42 35865204 | Cell:+92 324 4460969

column2: Helicopter needed to trasnport food and tents to Solukhumbu, Chaurikarka area

Please contact Babita Gurung or Raju Gurung 9804115871,9856038871, who will travel to KTM tomorrow, by food and tents from donated money and need urgent helicopter. Thank you!

column2: Talu, Helambu - needs food via helicopter
column5:
Posted on NERVC's Facebook page, evening Tuesday May 5th (Nepal time)

There is a small village Talu with approx. 25 People (incl. children) in the Helambu area off the trekking trail. They have food left for just one more day. It's a remote village located at a 3 days walking distance from the nearest road access. Is there anybody who could organise a helicopter to bring them food? You can reach them on following numbers (no English speaking): 9611074298 or 9611011746.

Do you know if anyone can assist them and provide relief supplies?

column2: Food Needed in this area outside of KTM: sanu kanchha tamang saramthali 6 kavre
column5:
hello,
Our Nepal tour guide for the "royal mountain travel nepal,"  Tamang Jange, lives in a village outside of KTM. We stayed in touch with him via Facebook and he says he is safe, but that his family and village need food badly. The government is providing minimal food and supplies, but NOT ENOUGH. We want to help but don't know how to get food and supplies directly to him and his village. Please advise! I'm honestly not sure I can decipher the address myself. Any advice and help would be amazing.

Tamang Jange
His address: sanu kanchha tamang saramthali 6 kavre

column5:
The Langtang Lirung Foundation is organizing relief to Langtang and surrounding areas. Can be contacted via facebook at their page "Langtang Lirung Foundation." Below is a fb post reposted from Langtang Search and Relief Updates (May 4th)

We are trying to provide relief efforts to Langtang and surrounding area. We are trying to collect information about where the relief efforts are needed. So far, it looks like the survivors of Langtang that are staying in Kathmandu as well as the ones in Kyanjin gumba are all being provided for by other organizations so we are directing our efforts to surrounding rural areas. So far we've sent supplies to village in Dolakha and Melamchi near Helambu region. We could really use your help to figure out where the help is needed the most. We've heard reports saying there are people starving in Gatlang which we are trying to figure out how to get to. Can we combine our efforts? Do you guys have more volunteers in Kathmandu that you can connect us with that can help our ground team with the relief efforts? Looks like you've been doing some really good work collecting and combining information and I think together with our relief efforts we can help a lot more. Please let us know. Thank you.
column20:
I'm going to be bringing a 4-7 person medical team from the United States within the next 10 days or so. Will you need assistance in the Langtang region? Thanks.

Josh K

column4: Ree Gaun, Gandaki, Western Region, Nepal, 45100
column5:
Coordinates;
N 28 06.324
E 84 59.235
Whole village dispersed, approx. 700 people now living in 4 new tent villages close together. 
Water: Main issue is that the water source is a half hour walk away across a landslide. Therefore specific request is for 3km length of 32mm diamter piping &amp; 1x 15kg bag of cement to channel water to new location (ideally by helicopter).
Sanitation is not being handled well so concerns over the water source are high. Failing this, perhaps large water containers could be dropped or at least large quantities of hand sanitizer - soap is irrelevant at this time. 
Also required; blankets and clothing as there are currently none.
Medical status: there are no critical injuries but widespread diarrhoea, hacking cough and infected small wounds. There is a trainee medical practitioner to whom we have given our medical supplies. His contact details; Ramesh Tamang 9741273827. He is requesting more bandages, suture sets, pain killers, diarrhoea medicine etc. as his clinic was completely destroyed. 

We have managed to arrange privately a small helicopter to land in Sattyadevi to airlift out 2 injured people. This is happening 5/5 and at the same time some food and additional medicine (focussing on diarrhoea) will be dropped to be shared with this village cluster in Ree VDC.

Additional information; the team just (2pm May 5th) witnessed an army helicopter landed today down hill from Ree village (coordinates above) but within Ree VDC at a new school building (probably known landmark) 10 army personnel handing out supplies.

column2: Sangachok village in Sindhupalchowk needs a lot of help!
column5:
Prepared by: Elis Hyusnyueva
Village: Sangachok
District: Sindhupalchowk
Nepal
Date of visit: 04/05/2015
Estimated population: around 7000
Damage on buildings: 90 % of houses collapsed, 10 % with major cracks and unsuitable for living inside
Transport and accessibility: Cars and buses can access the village, but there have been many landslides on the way and due to the continuous aftershocks, there is a risk of blockage of the roads. The landscape of the village is very hilly with variation of altitudes across the whole area, which has caused blockage of pathways, covered with rubble. The access to the main road is difficult.
Aid presence: So far only the organisation Save the children has reached with help to the settlement, delivering food and providing medical support. Most of the supplies could not reach the village, since they have been taken and utilized by the villages at lower altitude.
Shelter: 100 % of people live outside, around 10 % sleep in tents or under plastic sheets
Food: 50 % of people have food supply for about a week, 50 % less than a week
Drinking water: Local source, but shortage reported
No report for conflicts and aggression so far.
The village needs: shelter (tents), medicines (for cold, cholera, diarrhea, painkillers, water purification means), sanitation equipment (soap, hand sanitizers), food, water

column2: Urgent: trekkers and medical aid for Sindupalchok - Baruwa (23007) - Villages: Yasra, Yangri, Bolgaun, Baruwa, Dhap, Bhotang
column5:
Help has been up to Dhap. The villages beyond haven't been reached. Survivors need urgent medical assistance.

Advice from trekkers is to prioritise medical aid to these areas. Take Melamchi-Bothang Road to Dhap. Baruwa and Bhotang are 2-3h trek from Dhap in different directions.

Some places were swept away into the river. Corpses all around.

Contact Deepak Rana (9741174474)
column6: Medical Evacuation, Medical Assiatance, Food/Water/Shelter/Sanitation, Food/Water,
column19: Some help has reached to the area. But they still need food, water and medical and sanitation aid.
column20: Medical aid needs to be sent to villages of Yasra, Yangri, Bolgaun, Baruwa, Dhap, and Bhotang. They will also need food and water. The contact could not confirm the population in these villages. He was uptp Dhap and was told about the villages above.

column5: Bageshwori, Ward # 8, Bhaktapur Mr. Radhe Shyam Shrestha (98418 83176) says no state help has reached his village which is just 22 KM from Kathmandu. There are 100 household in his ward and they are in desperate need of Tent/Tarpaulin and simple Mattress. Appreciate group working in that area to reach him out earliest possible.
column20: This place is 4 km from Kamal Binayak, Ward no. 8, Bageshwori, Bhaktapur.There is 60-70 houses. They had received relief earlier but every 3 household is using 1 tent. So they are in need of tents.

column2: Need for aid in Bhim Khori village (Kavre)
column5:
A team of volunteers yesterday reached Bhim Khori village (diversion to village is on BP Highway, near Pipley).

The village is a 1 hour drive away from the main highway (track road, meant for trucks or Bolero vehicles only). 

The villagers have not received any aid. We distributed some food supplies, tent and clothes. Their condition is very dire.
column19: Some food supplies, tent and clothes have been distributed. Their condition is still very serious.

column2: Medical assistance needed! Godhra Godawari 3, Lalitpur
column4: Godawari - Phulchoki Road, Godawari, Bagmati, Central Region, Nepal, 44709
column5: Approximately 450 people have been made homeless. One elderly lady has a severe injury to the head Several other people have minor injuries There are also 8-10 pregnant ladies Contact: Mr Karna Lama, 9849 220 823
column19: Contact has been made with Dr. Poonam. Her team got in touch with Mr. Lama. The team assessed that it would be best to bring the elderly lady requiring treatment to Patan Hospital while the pregnant ladies were checked by a health team.
column20: Followed up with Dr. Poonam. She said that her team got in touch with Mr. Lama. The team assessed that it would be best to bring the elderly lady requiring treatment to Patan Hospital while the pregnant ladies were checked by a health team which arrived in the location a day before Dr. Poonam got in touch with Mr. Lama.

column2: Need volunteers to clean rubble in Manamaiju
column5: Request for volunteers to help in Manamaiju at 12 for rubble clearing. We are bringing some relief food items for this. We need experienced people who have already worked in other disaster areas. Request sent by: Sabin Joshi. Phone number: 9808200900. SMS sent by: Aayush Khadka, quakemaps.org.

We are looking for the little brother on this picture. His name is Tenzin, he is about 13y old and on the day of the earthquake he was most probably in school in syabrubesi. If you have seen this boy or if you know anything about the school in syabrubesi, please let us know something. His big brother (also on the picture) is waiting for him in his monastery in kathmandu.
column19: Need to find out the contact number for the brother of the missing person.
column20: Please registered the missing person at http://familylinks.icrc.org/nepal-earthquake/en/pages/register-missing.aspx

column2: Urgent needs of relief supplies in villages of Katunje VDC
column5:
Many villagers in Katunje VDC(Dhading District) are homeless, and going hungry due to food shortage.  Adequate sheltering is lacking due to insufficient necessary supplies.

Immediate basic relief of food, clean water, hygiene items, medicine, tents, blankets is desperately needed.
column19: Organizations have reached there but there is still requirement of relief most importantly in Ward no. 6,7. Transportation by road is possible.
column20: In Dhading District, Katgunje VDC their is need of  Food(50 sack of Rice and Daal), Clear water and tent.  Their are 160 houses in total.Organization had earlier reached there but there is still requirement of relief most importantly in Ward no. 6,7. Transportation by road is possible.

Posted on NERVC's Facebook page

EVENING MAY 4
Received request for tent, tripaal from Sindhupalchwok, dhandkhola - 40 homes - pls help 
Contact: Baburam Dhakal, local and victim - 9840021411 (this is not exactly his number but he will receive message and make calls from this number).
column20: In Sindhulchowk,Phatak Sila VDC, Ward no. 8, Dhakalchowk with 40 households and Danwar village with 300-400 households they haven't received any materials. Other villages far from the market also has not received relief. They are in urgent need of Tent, Food, Medical service and Water. Transportation is possible till the market the locals can come to receive it. They complain that relief material is reaching to the market but not to the villages.

EVENING MAY 4
Received request for tent, tripaal from kerabari VDC - 5, 
Gorkha - Near bhachhek, victim 90 homes
Contact person in Kathmandu is Deep Chandra Regmi - 9851123130, he is coordinating with team of people from Gorkha to send relief material..
column20: Spoke to Deep Chandra Regmi (9851123130) who is a part of group of people from Kerabari living in Kathmandu. He has managed 15-20 tents through personal donations but needs a total of 100. They have a team on the ground assessing the requirements. Number for a tent company smsed.

column2: Samundradevi, Nuwakot - urgently needs shelter, foods, meds
column4: Samundradevi, Nuwakot, Bagmati, Central Region, Nepal, 44900
column5:
Posted on NERVC's Facebook page by Charlotte Benham, Original poster Gyan Bahadur Lama, originally posted late in the day on May 4th (Nepal time)

Nuwakot Samundradevi V.D.C. is in crisis... 855 houses are collapsed. People there are having a very hard time. Please, if anyone wants to help by providing tents, blankets, food items, and water purifiers, sanitation kit and medicines. You can contact Dr. Nancy Lama 9841480422 or 9813141000 she is the one coordinating Samundra Devi VDC's disaster relief program right now!
column19: People urgently need medical aid, food, water and tents.
column20: Dr. Nancy and her team are providing medical support at Samundradevi V.D.C. , Nuwakot. but have limited medicines. people there are facing fungal infections. children are having allergies and old aged people are having skin infections. Half of the households out of total are in need of tents. they are also in need of food stuffs. half part of the village have good drinking water and half are running out of water. they also need water purifier.

column2: Saranpur in Sitapaila Ward 13/14 Needs aid
column5:
A large number of families have still received no aid in Saranpur. among theses specific families, 90percent have lost their houses. They are without food and water for 3 days.

We delivered 1000kgs food and some transparent tarpaulin yesterday (04-05-15) to approx 100 people

we identified approx 115 people still in dire need

the survivors are not concentrated in a camp, which makes accessing them difficult, we had to go door to door and assess needs individually.

red cross delivered some tents and medicine 7-8 days ago but not sufficient

Contact given details for coordinator based in Kathmandu

About 40 children lost their boarding school in Dandagaon and are now staying under a tarp.  Temporary relief was provided by the Webster family (Sivapuri Heights Cottage), but additional food and supplies are needed.

contact person: Ramesh
column20:
Relief materials have reached to Dandagaon.
They want the Dandagaon school and other houses reconstructed.

column2: Earthquake Assessment Report | Gati &amp; Ghumthang VDC - Sindupalchowk
column5:
01st May 2015 | Namaste Nepal
Villages Assessed / Being Assessed
Gati, Dandakateri, Nakuche, Samasadhu, Mandra and Sotang.
Location on Strava - https://www.strava.com/activities/297713765
Gati - 112 Households
Damage - Only three structures standing (Kindergarten, a hollow brick house, and part of the secondary school)
Deaths - 4
The trail leading to Gati is shredded, and there are open gash landslides. The agricultural road access has been damaged by landslide or rocks standing on the way. The water taps are suddenly full of water (looks like a new acquifer has joined with the original source)
Dandakateri - 78 Households
Damage - Only three houses standing (hollow brick houses)
Deaths - 3
The trail leading to Dandakateri is damaged and shredded. The ancient trail to Tibet connecting Dandakateri and Gati is dangerous as there are rocks hanging out from the recent landslides caused by the earthquake. The water dried out here, but the locals have braved the conditions and re-connected the pipes, so water is back on. The spring water is a bit sour (sulphur?)
Reports still coming in from Mandra, Sotang, Nakuche and Samasadu. Teams were there on recce on the 01st and 02nd of May.
This will expand the coverage of this report to about 1000 households, but only covers 6 wards of the two VDC’s which have a total of 18 wards. This is the immediate working area of Namaste Nepal, but relief might have to be expanded to cover the two VDC’s, which will take the total to about 3000 households.
They are bringing back list of households, the damage report, the death toll, the number of children below 10 and the number of children below 5.
——
Two board members of Namaste Nepal are from this village. Mohan Shrestha and Ramesh Lama, both of whom have lost their houses.
Adaptation: The villagers in this area are constructing temporary shelters from wood and tin salvaged from their broken down houses, and using bamboo and some agricultural plastic or tarp or tin. Some have even used the slate that was on the roof as flooring material. Some are sleeping on straw.
The dead have been cremated and the animals buried. The villagers are extremely busy building their medium term shelters
Emergency Relief Priorities
Tarp
Rice and Lentils and supplemental food supplies
Mid Term Priorities (though best to go in straight away)
Temporary toilets
Water Tests
Temporary school
Temporary Health Post with supplies
Temporary gathering space for meetings for village level decisions
Methodology:
In a discussion with the Board of Namaste Nepal, these were the decisions made locally
The emergency relief supplies would be controlled by the Youth Groups - a leader has already been formed, and the base for this will be the Borderlands Resort, which is connected by road.
Lists of all households will be used to ensure there is no duplicacy
In case of shortages of supplies, women with children, marginalised groups will be prioritised. 
NOTE: And example of this was already in practice. As we reached with low supplies, the youth group immediately decided in favour of marginalised groups and the Dalits got the first priority in this area. After that, the rest was kept in storage awaiting better supplies, in order to maintain social harmony.
An information board has been set up at Borderlands for Rescue teams, international aid coming in, and help groups coming in that area - outlining who all has already reached there, and trying to collate what they learnt in order to avoid duplicacy.
Challenges
Safety. The area is still very fragile and the tremors are felt more than in other places. There is a chance that some landslides will happen, specially if it rains
Pilferage. Reaching Gati needs going via the Dolalghat - Barabise stretch where some looting has happened of goods going in. Police protection is required. We thought of bringing in locals when the supplies are ready.
Communications. Only when reaching higher grounds there is some cellphone reception. This could improve over time.
Dependency. The help that is given should be supporting the priorities each village is taking in the relief and rebuilding process, and should not feed into the Dependency Syndrome that aid brings.

column2: Urgent need for relief supplies and food in Katunje (Dhading)

Relief supplies such as tents, blankets, food, water and medicine are desperately needed.

column2: Hansatar in Siutar Municipality not receiving adequate relief
column5: Hansatar of Siutar Municipaity which is just in the outskirts of Kalanki has not yet received adequate relief materials. The roads have been blocked due to rubble of the fallen houses. Locals have reported that the relief that was distributed have not been adequate for everyone and an environment of chaos has been created with people already receiving relief snatching more of it. About 200 people have been affected in the ward. The are in need of tents and pals because about 90% of the houses have been reduced to rubble. They are also in need of food. Rajendra Lama can be contacted at 9860432488.

column4: Manaslu, Manaslu Conservation Area, Samagaun, Gandaki, Western Region, Nepal
column5: As per the information received from a guy from Larke, kids and older people are stranded there. There is no way they can cross the landslide area. They need to be picked up from Larke and dropped off in Bhuntang(village down stream).
column19: They are evacuated. They are dropped off in Bhuntang.
column20: They are evacuated. They are dropped off in Bhuntang.

column5: Visited this village. At present there is no electricity, scarcity of clean drinking water, NTC communication is fixed but NCELL is not working. One sack of rice and one box of noodles for each household distributed between 5/4 and 5/5. No shelter assistance, About 300 houses still need shelters. Some people are begining to build tin shelters. Village is accessible after 1.5 hours walk from Samundrataar, Nuwakot.
column20: No contact information.

9851026123 shree
column19: There have received food and blankets as relief, now they are in need of tents!

column5:
Yellow House team in Dhading district were in Ree VDC and around 1-2 hours walk away still from their final destination = Ward No. 7, Tajimrang Village.

Tarps and anti diarrhoea medicine seems to be most urgent so we are procuring these as best we can.

Supplies from our team were split 50/50 between this village and Sattyadevi. Also some supplies have been distributed along the route so I cannot 100% specify which supplies have made it to the final destination. 

Most urgent information shared; the team today gave information about a specific village they passed through on their route. I do not know the village name unfortunately but this was the worst affected village my team saw so far on their two day walk up from Dhading Besi;
GPS coordinates: 
N 28 05.323
E 35 00.073 
(Upon verifying, I believe they meant:28°05'32.3"N 85°00'07.3''E
Contact number for the village: 9741334530 (although signal is very poor)

The situation in this village alone is around 250 homes destroyed. Approx 1500 people with 300+ suffering from diarrhoea. Many, many livestock killed and buried. Extremely high level of flies in the area. The village could be smelt a long way off. There was also one baby with numerous infected, puss filled marks around it's head. The team delivered basic first aid and recommended going down to the nearest hospital but it seemed that advice would not be followed.

column2: The Tamang village of Briddim requires help
column4: Briddim V.D.C Ward No-3, Rasuwa District, Bagmat, Nepal
column5:
The Tamang village of Briddim requires immediate aid. Food supplies are required immediately. The homes are in unlivable condition. Population ~100

The roads are blocked all around the area.
It is a three hour hike from the nearest road-accessible town Shyephru Besi. The road to Shyephru Besi is inaccessible due to landslides blocking and destroying parts of the road.

column5:
35 of 38 houses in the village of Quaro in Kirtipur municipality have been destroyed. 

It is close to Taudaha pond. Quaro has only received 10 tents after the relief truck was diverted by five men on motorcycles.
column19: Lions Club has provided enough tarps for everyone over. They have also committed to provide food for 6 months.
column20:
Contact Info has been updated now. 

Lions Club has provided enough tarps for everyone in the VDC. They have also committed to provide food for 6 months.

column2: The village of Dadagaun needs immediate support
column4: H04, Pida, Bagmati, Central Region, Nepal
column5:
The village of Dadagaun, located just outside Kathmandu in the valley, on the Trishuli highway. Road access is open. 
The village has had most of its homes collapsed in the earthquake. There is a shortage of food, medical attention and adequate shelter. 
Contact:  Diwakar Devkota from the village @ +9779841510750  cellphone service hasn't been available in the village but he is going into town for communication purposes.
column20: There are 55-65 households in the village, Dadagaun (Ward 8). These families are all displaced. There is a shortage of food, medicines and shelter.

column4: Likhu, Nuwakot, Bagmati, Central Region, Nepal
column5: Likhu VDC in Nuwakot District homes have been completely destroyed.  Using tarps from helecopters that dropped them, but there has not yet been any direct support.  Families are sharing shelters.  No other support has been provided.  24 people have died.  They have some food stocks but it is limited.  Maybe about 1 week of supplies.   Still further needs for shelter and will soon be need for food (rice, dal, salt etc).  Not serious need for medical support.
column19: They had received relief as 25 Tents and few Foods. Now they need more food supply in Ward No.- 7 of VDC Likhu.
column20:
They had received relief as 25 Tents and few Foods.
 
Now they need more food supply in Ward No.- 7 of VDC Likhu.
Here there are 500 houses.

Till now there is no disease observed among the locals.

column19: HR ct The need at Ward 1 may have been met but needs location confirmation before closing, please see Sparrow crisis map incident for Jivanpur 5 Dhading - http://help.sparrowsms.com/reports/view/1355 Comments: Pops Martin (May 6 2015) We've been there tod
column20:
HR ct The need at Ward 1 may have been met but needs location confirmation before closing, please see Sparrow crisis map incident for Jivanpur 5 Dhading - http://help.sparrowsms.com/reports/view/1355 Comments:     
Pops Martin (May 6 2015)
We've been there today. Food is not a big problem at the moment. They need tents. We've ordered 200 tents already and they should arrive 2 days from now. Further help efforts are under investigation.
Pops Martin (May 6 2015)
A series of pictures from Jeewanpur showing the situation there: http://nepinfo.org/listing/jeewanpur-dhading/
Pops Martin (May 9 2015)
Help has arrived there! Our guys are on location to build temporary tents and to start building wood shelters on the former school ground. This place should be safe by now.

column2: TENTS AND FOOD NEEDED - BHALCHE VDC, NUWAKOT
column5:
BHALCHE VDC, wards of 3, 4, 5, 6  and the villages of Dandathok, Kesing Kokta, Ngarchet, Kotgaun, Karmang Tho, Hengchakot, CHYEKU inhabited entirely by Tamang and Ghale Gurungs 340 households have collapsed where in average 1700 people affected. Bhalche VDC has about 900 households total. Info only for 4 wards.
30 people died. 
Injured people have been taken to Trishuli hospital.
They are in desperate need of tents and food. 
People from the village will walk down 30 mins to an hour to Karchet village where vehicles can bring relief materials. Karchet lies on the left of Betrawati River on way to langtang.
column20: The phone is currently switched off.

column2: Helambu village, Sindhupalchok - no relief yet, road blocked
column5:
Posted on NERVC's Facebook page 13 hours prior to submission of this report by Gupri Dosanjh (who is on Facebook), no phone number given


There is a small village which is 5 hrs drive from kathmandu. " Helambu" . The whole village has been damaged and not the single home remains. The rescue team has not reached that place yet because the road has been blocked due to labdslide. Of anyone knows where this is!!

column2: Misusing The Provisions For Earthquake Victims By Rich People...
column5: I just yesterday witnessed a person having 5 storayed house in Sano Bharyang having no any damage. The person have 5 cars.Still he is taking 5 tents with his power.I just knew it today from the local people. He sayed " This will be useful for me to cover my cars later ".Knowing the fact that the country is suffering from great quake.People are misusing their power and snatching the poor property or provision. I request you to inform the police. But unfortunately I can't tell my name nor the person's name.That incidence occurred 2 days ago around Sano Bharyang...

Some supplies arrived, but still need food and shelter for 6800 people in the Sauripani VDC, Gorkha. No food on stock. Illness is on the rise, serious cases have evacuated, but still need for more assistance and medicines.

Established a base of operation there. Will be doing ongoing support to outlying villages in the VDC. Also working Simjung and Swara VDCs from the base in Sauripani. We can cover only a small amout of the needs.

column2: Assesment by DFID-GIZ Risk Management Office (RMO)
column5:
1.   Key Highlights

·         668 schools in 37 districts have been completely destroyed and 1819 schools have been partially damaged. In Sindhupalchowk and Kavrepalanchowk 180 schools each have been destroyed. Most of the schools in Kathmandu, Bhaktapur and Lalitpur districts have suffered damage.

·         Medical facilities (hospitals, health posts, primary health centres) in Sindhupalchowk, Nuwakot, Gorkha and Dhading have suffered severe damage.

·         Diarrhea is becoming widespread in Haku VDC, Rasuwa district and Laprak and Simjung VDCs in Gorkha district.
2.   Airport Status

·         Kathmandu airport and regional airports are all reported operational.
3.   Road Situation

Most major roads in the country are open. Road access to heavily affected VDCs is open via the following routes:

·         Gorkha: The road from Gorkha District Headquarters to Arughat (Arupokhari VDC) is operational, distance 43 km. The road from Arughat to Soti Khola (Lapu VDC) is also now open. 

·         Northern Nuwakot / Dhading: The gravel road from Trisuli / Bidur (Nuwakot district headquarters) to Kimtang VDC is in good condition and passable for heavy trucks. From Kimtang VDC, heavily affected VDCs of northern Dhading, Satyadevi and Darkha, are accessible on foot. The distance from Trisuli to Kimtang VDC is 35 km. (Kathmandu-Trisuli is 85 km by paved road in good condition.)

·         Dolakha: the main road via Khadichaur, Sindhupalchowk, Mude, Charikot and Mainapokhari to Jiri is open.

·          

The following closures are reported:

·         Sindhupalchok: Araniko highway between Bahrabise and Tatopani

·         Sindhupalchok: the road between Kathmandu and Melamchi is obstructed by landslide at Tipeni Bazar, 9 km before Melamchi.

·         Nuwakot / Rasuwa: Trisuli / Bidur to Dhunche. It is anticipated that this road will be re-opened by the evening of 3 May.

·         Dolakha: Charikot to Lamabagar VDC

·         Bhaktapur: Roads inside the main city are obstructed due to debris but are likely to be cleared by evening today.
4.   Security Updates

5.   Updates by District

 

Bhaktapur

·         Scarcity of Drinking water is reported in the Taumadi Village and in main city areas due to damaged water supply system.

Dolakha

·         3000 Yarchagumba pickers are still out of contact in Lamabagar area. 463 stranded in Lamabagar had been air lifted to Charikot by 02 May. There is an Armed Police Force base camp in Lamabagar.

·         According to the Chief District Officer, 4 foreigners are stranded in Simigaun.

·         Relief distribution is inadequate and delayed. In Kavre VDC where 1100 houses were damaged, only 18 tarpaulins were supplied. This leads to increasing dissatisfaction among the victims. Temporary shelters and blankets are the primary need in the affected VDCs.  

Rasuwa

·         44 dead bodies of locals have been removed from the debris in Langtang VDC. The Nepal Army has removed dead bodies of 6 foreign nationals, identified as two Italians, one each German and Malaysian and two as yet unidentified.

column20: This is an individual initiation by Sagar Chitar. They have distributed relief products to Kutari Square, Bhaktapur.

column5: Hyolmo, a remote area in the mountains at the border of Tibet, has suffered devastating damage, many medical injuries, and there has only been two small nonprofits providing limited aid. This area is being ignored by Nepal government . Please bring aid to Hyolmo, in the Helambu District. U.S. Citizen Christina Monson can give you the geographic coordinates. She is is Pharping Nepal.

But they need plastic tarp, blankets, sanitary pads, water and medical supplies.	<br /></p>

/></p><p><b>	Comments	</b>	Most of the latrines are destroyed and most people have diarrhea in the community. They are running out of food and water. If 20kg of rice is delivered per person, it will sustain them for 2 weeks. Many of them have minor injuries. They need building and cleaning equipment. Their health centre is badly damaged and only one community officer is present. They need medical supplies. They are using damaged houses and lack adequate shelter. Water shortage is a severe problem. They were connected with a Danish aid group. They organized bulldozers and a water tanker for the area. 	<br /></p>
